intro: Haplopappus stelliger, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations and limited water availability. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Haplopappus stelliger plays a role in stabilizing soil in desert environments and provides forage for wildlife.
